title: OpenWHO: Knowledge for Health Emergencies
description: OpenWHO is the World Health Organization's (WHO) interactive knowledge-transfer platform offering online courses to improve the response to health emergencies. OpenWHO enables the Organization and its key partners to transfer life-saving knowledge to large numbers of frontline responders. With OpenWHO, you have the flexibility to learn at your convenience. Watch the short video lectures and test your knowledge with self-tests when and where you like. The course forum and the collaboration space allow you to get in touch with other participants and experts around the world. Designed primarily for health care workers, frontline responders, and decision-makers, the app is also a source of information for those affected by disease outbreaks and health emergencies, or for those with a general interest in WHO's work in health emergencies. It features 6 channels: - The Outbreak channel addresses the management of infectious diseases and provides life-saving, scientific information. - The Ready for Response channel helps prepare personnel who are training for deployment to work in disease outbreaks and health emergencies. - The Get Social channel focuses on social science-based interventions and helps to communicate with affected communities. - The Preparing for Pandemics channel brings together courses on various aspects of preparedness, including surveillance, public health measures and risk communication during a pandemic. - The COVID-19 channel provides learning resources in WHO's 6 official languages (Arabic, Chinese, English, French, Russian and Spanish) for health professionals, decision-makers and the public for the outbreak of coronavirus disease (COVID-19). - The COVID-19 National Languages channel provides the same learning resources as the COVID-19 channel but in national languages, such as Indonesian, Japanese and Portuguese. OpenWHO courses are available in many languages, including WHO's 6 official languages. Download the app now, and join the OpenWHO community. This app is developed in cooperation between the Hasso Plattner Institute and the WHO. The learning content is provided exclusively by the WHO.
descriptionHTML:
OpenWHO is the World Health Organization's (WHO) interactive knowledge-transfer platform offering online courses to improve the response to health emergencies. OpenWHO enables the Organization and its key partners to transfer life-saving knowledge to large numbers of frontline responders.

With OpenWHO, you have the flexibility to learn at your convenience. Watch the short video lectures and test your knowledge with self-tests when and where you like. The course forum and the collaboration space allow you to get in touch with other participants and experts around the world.

Designed primarily for health care workers, frontline responders, and decision-makers, the app is also a source of information for those affected by disease outbreaks and health emergencies, or for those with a general interest in WHO's work in health emergencies.

It features 6 channels:
- The Outbreak channel addresses the management of infectious diseases and provides life-saving, scientific information.
- The Ready for Response channel helps prepare personnel who are training for deployment to work in disease outbreaks and health emergencies.
- The Get Social channel focuses on social science-based interventions and helps to communicate with affected communities.
- The Preparing for Pandemics channel brings together courses on various aspects of preparedness, including surveillance, public health measures and risk communication during a pandemic.
- The COVID-19 channel provides learning resources in WHO's 6 official languages (Arabic, Chinese, English, French, Russian and Spanish) for health professionals, decision-makers and the public for the outbreak of coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
- The COVID-19 National Languages channel provides the same learning resources as the COVID-19 channel but in national languages, such as Indonesian, Japanese and Portuguese.

OpenWHO courses are available in many languages, including WHO's 6 official languages.

Download the app now, and join the OpenWHO community.

This app is developed in cooperation between the Hasso Plattner Institute and the WHO. The learning content is provided exclusively by the WHO.
summary: Life-saving knowledge for frontline responders in health emergencies.
summaryHTML: Life-saving knowledge for frontline responders in health emergencies.

- Subtitle support for Google Cast
- Bug fixes and performance improvements

comments: Can't open the app it's showing server issues
I actually love this app. It's useful! I can read and internalize the whole things there. Thanks a lot!

This app is an excellent & flexible learning platform! It includes relevant learning resources, tailored to the learning needs of healthcare professionals, especially in combating COVID-19. With barely 3-month experience, this learning medium has fully capacitated my understanding of COVID-19, in terms of IPC, Risk Communication, & Case Management, among several others. I'm highly grateful to WHO for this learning opportunity, & I would like to recommend it to all healthcare workers.
Great learning experience 👍

Great app for healthcare providers who are willing to learn about the global health issues especially to the emerging viruses that may cause pandemics. Convenient and easy to access plus it's free, it has also certificate for some of their training courses. Great job, WHO!

The app keeps showing me this message (please enable network connection) when I open it, don't know why ?? My internet connection is working fine and I am using all the other apps perfectly well. Can you lend me a hand in this matter.
